clinical_history: Patient with persistent infection and fever of unknown origin.
findings: Focal uptake in brain temporal lobe consistent with post-surgical changes.
Multiple hypermetabolic lesions in bones, suggestive of metastases.
No evidence of new metastatic lesions compared to prior scan.
Diffuse mild increased uptake in liver, likely benign.
No abnormal FDG uptake in the remaining organs.
recommendations: Repeat PET-CT in 3–6 months to monitor treatment response.
